column4: Not sure that's true, ubuntu aims to be easy to use out of the box.
maybe buy a machine with linux pre-installed, then you don't have to worry about hardware compatibiltiy.

i agree, ubuntu is great!  but it will inevitably have to face a problem that mac never will.  ubuntu supports lots of different hardware manufacturers while all the hardware that goes into macintosh is proprietary
therefore, mac will always be more ready to go out of the box than windows, linux, or any other OS that doesn't come pre-bundled with proprietary hardware
